description: Blend of motor +‎ hotel, from the original Motel Inn of San Luis Obispo in California, USA, established in 1925 by Arthur Heineman (1878–1974).

entries.meaning: (also attributive) A type of hotel or lodging establishment, often located near a major highway, which typically features a series of rooms the entrances of which are immediately adjacent to a parking lot to facilitate convenient access to automobiles parked there.
A low-cost short-stay hotel, often with hourly rates rather than daily rates, and notorious for permitting illicit sexual activities; love hotel.

verbs.description: motel (third-person singular simple present motels, present participle moteling or motelling, simple past and past participle moteled or motelled)

entries.meaning: (informal, intransitive) To stay in a motel or motels.
